website_summaries.verdict: With its excellent Wi-Fi coverage, lightning-fast speed, reliability, and how simple this it is to install, this is sure to be a step up from a cable company’s rental modem.
pros: Dual band secures the best connection for your current task
Works with all major cable providers
cons: A little pricy, but worth the long-term investment

customer_reviews.title: Bummer, died after 5 months use ...
customer_reviews.text: Bummer, I came on to find out warranty info because we bought this in May and it stopped working in Nov. Our internet provider came out and confirmed it's done. It was a lot to pay for 5 months of use. We wanted to save in the long term vs renting from Time Warner. Has anyone had any luck with a refund after this much time? Such a drag. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: M M

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the value... Look at other brand if you are looking to purchase
customer_reviews.text: It would seems that I am not the only one with the consistent dropped WiFi Signal. And guess what, this is the worst NetGear router that I have EVER own (and I own a number of them in my lifetime). The predecessor (also another NetGear Router) died after almost 4 years of usage - which I think is an acceptable time frame. This one, have it for about a year and then the drop signal started. I guess I am in the market for another router again and this time I can assure you it won't be NetGear. So basically, a complete waste of $$.
customer_reviews.author: PennyPinching

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION AFTER ALMOST 5 YEARS.
customer_reviews.text: Update!! After almost 5 years this router still working.. cant regret buying this i dont think i ever will since this router after all this time keeps giving me very strong wifi speed i live in a 1 bedroom and as long as you are using the 5G setting.. u will be more than pleased!!. Had this router for a very long time now.. i highly recommend this. I have 2 smart tvs a ps4 and 4 phones in my house that are always connected to the wifi streaming netflix in one tv and Disney+ in another 1 at the same time and zero buffering.. just a grest experience so far.
customer_reviews.author: FERNANDO ESTRADA

customer_reviews.title: 5 months old and it DIES!
customer_reviews.text: Bummer! I was so excited to buy this all-in-one miracle. Not long after I got this, the signal would drop at the least expected times or movies that were streaming would have to stop to download. Netflix and the cable company got the blame but every time they checked everything was working great. Then BAM! It just went black today. Called the cable company, we ran through all the tricks and the final prognosis... it's dead. If you buy one of these be sure to invest in a long term warranty. I was so confident this was the end all, be all... who needs a warranty? Turns out I did! Still old and a tad wiser.
customer_reviews.author: Southern lady

customer_reviews.title: Also Netgear customer service sucks big time as there is no support after 90 ...
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in lot of other reviews, this router keeps losing connection multiple times a day just 6 months after purchase. I need to keep resetting the router to get it to work again. Its really frustrating and not something I expect from $150 router. Also Netgear customer service sucks big time as there is no support after 90 days unless you pay $50 to just talk to customer service rep with no guarantee that your product will still be fixed or not. Stay away from this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 8 months, then it suddenly stopped emitting both the 2.4 and 5.0 ghz networks. I had my internet service provider come out and they confirmed it was not their issue, they hooked up one of their own routers and it worked perfectly. When I reached out to Netgear support they said that I had to purchase a $130 service plan to even trouble shoot the issue to determine whether or not this fell within their 1-year warranty on hardware related issues.
customer_reviews.author: Solena correa

customer_reviews.title: No internet, defective product right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: It would not connect with Cox Cable. It could not register or assign an IP. Cox (Tier 2) Support suspected it was used once with another provider, returned, and resold (?). I refunded the purchase and bought one locally, rather than wait three days. Netgear support only told me to return it. Netgear support was poor.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: The router looks great and is basically hassle free for install. My issue is with the daily use of it. It drops the connection and reboots every other day, will sometimes lock you out of the WiFi because it thinks it’s having a DDos attack and recently it has been giving us errors inside the router login when we go to manually reboot or update settings. One of the best looking pieces of art in our house and it’s just that...a router that blinks and does the whole dog and pony show of looking like a router without actually doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: We have been dealing with router problems for over a year now, cycling through three different products. Every top of the line router of other brands did not reach every part of our house, would have issues keeping devices connected, or simply drop connection every few hours. After using this C6300 for a while, we have noticed no interruptions and strong, clear internet everywhere in our home. We are very happy with this purchase and highly recommend this product. Note: We contacted Netgear customer support during setup and they were EXTREMELY helpful and resolved our issue in minutes (it was an issue with our ISP, not the router!)
customer_reviews.author: Sco

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great Until one Month After Warranty
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought crapped out after a month. Amazon hastily sent a replacement unit which worked for 1 year and one month, conveniently one month after the warranty. Tried to talk to someone at Netgear and after filling out an online form, was told via automated reply, that since the warranty had expired (by one month) I was not eligible to even talk to anybody. Their customer service number is hidden and unless you pay for support, you cannot speak with anyone. It's bad enough that the router/modem is defective but to be denied the chance to even talk to anybody is crap service. This will be the last Netgear product I ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Derdington

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money if you want to use it for Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: I spent countless hours to make it work for Spectrum (Time Warner) Cable. I spent lots of money for headache. I cannot change setting on my laptop and if i need to access the router on my laptop or desktop first i need to reboot the router then use it on my laptop and after one login if I try to use second time again I have to reboot the router. I call netgear support they said it is Spectrum issue that they have not pushed the current firmware then I call Spectrum they said my firmware is up-to-date. Never buy this if you want to use for Spectrum and want to manage wireless setting on your laptop or desktop.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hameed

customer_reviews.title: Modem died after 5 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: This modem died on me after 5 weeks. After spending 2 hours with a time warner tech support trouble shooting this garbage. I went back to my 5 year old zoom modem and it worked. So I called netgear tech support which linked me up with a rep in India who wanted me to connect my laptop to the netgear modem to try to trouble shoot it differently by 'changing the dns'. And without attempting to troubleshoot with him he said could not honor the warranty. Too techincal for me. No thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Beware-Contains Intel Puma 6 Chipset
customer_reviews.text: Contains the Intel Puma 6 chipset which has latency and packet drop issues. I have an amplifier insstalled on my cable service between the wall jack and the Negear C6300 AC1750 so I am getting a very strong internet signal. My internet suffered from random dropouts and bandwidth loss. I returned this and installed a unit with a Broadcom chip and my problems disappeared. Read about the Intel Puma 6 chipset before you purchase this device.
customer_reviews.author: Happy woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and good WiFi range
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to eliminate my modem rental fee from Xfinity, and it should pay for itself in less than 10 months, so good purchase. One positive I didn’t expect - the extended WiFi range! We live in a 3 story house and with my rented modem/WiFi router, we needed a WiFi extender to get any service on the third floor; even then, the signal was mediocre. This modem/router extends to the third floor, and the signal is solid. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Works great and saving $13 month rental
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy TV and internet so I need a reliable source for WiFi. When I knew that I could own a compatible modem/ router rather than rent it from Comcast for $13 month, I jumped at the chance. Netgear customer service/ support was totally helpful in installation as I'm inept at electronic/ computer stuff. (I'm 83). The used unit I purchased has functioned perfectly since it was activated except for a couple of days of minutes of on and off WiFi. It fixed itself. I wish I had purchased a unit sooner.
customer_reviews.author: nancy m

customer_reviews.title: Fussy & a tiny pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use 4 a WiFi calling service but later determined to be a FLOP. My WiFi signal on my cellphone & tablet; drop's and then reconnects once in a blue-moon. I never had a issue with the WiFi on my other internet modem that sadly; I sold on a free app to a guy in Wisconsin or Michigan. But oh well it's not a major issue yet ! And as 4 the technical person part, he helped in no way and to get further help, I have to pay for further help with my device. C- on WiFi and F- on tech help. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: SLittle

customer_reviews.title: Fickle but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was throwing away money renting the Cox modem. It works fairly well! I am now able to get my speeds up past 150 mbps, which is what I’ve been paying for all along. However, it frequently disconnects when either me or my boyfriend are on our laptops. It sometimes has to be restarted (which takes a really long time in comparison to any other modem I’ve had in the past), but it works great while I’m working from home on my work computer (which is at least 40 hours a week). It gets the job done I guess!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Better than great!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to hook up. No call to Comcast (which I dreaded 'cause you know how that goes) needed. Activated online instantly and works so much faster and more reliable than the modem I was renting from Comcast for 10 dollars a month. I no longer have to reboot to get internet back! It is a fast, dependable connection on all my equipment including a 10 year old laptop! Netflix and Prime stream without any stuttering or loading delays. My only regret is that I did not purchase this sooner. Love the ease of connecting new equipment and the stability of the connection even when using multiple connections at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Set up with xFinity/Comcast no problems in just a few minutes. It's a noticeable improvement over the gateway I was leasing as part of the internet plan. Especially when it comes to uploading with our phones and using the Chromecast/Firestick. We've had it two weeks now and no problems at all. The admin interface is pretty nice and I like that I don't have to type in the gateway's numeric IP (since I can never remember it due to infrequency of use) I can just type routerlogin.net
customer_reviews.author: UrKungFuNoGood

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy Netgear again
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage. I work from home and this thing drops a signal whenever it feels like it. I called customer support and since I’ve owned it for more than 90 days they won’t even troubleshoot. They produce junk and sell it without ever standing behind it. I will never buy Netgear again. One last thing... their automated system for their customer support line was INFURIATING. Don’t even bother calling them. What a terrible company.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Golyshko

customer_reviews.title: Problematic device and zero support
customer_reviews.text: This device worked great for the first few months of owning it, but since then it's been terrible. It will reset itself several times a day with diagnostic error codes that could help Netgear solve it. But, unfortunately, they refuse to offer support for products after you've owned them for 90 days. So if your product starts to act up 3+ months after owning it, sucks to be you. The WiFi also drops out, IpPv4 connections stop working for no reason, this device needs a hard reset every month, and there's absolutely nothing that can be done to fix any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Netgear support is non-existant
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item at the end of April this year. It worked GREAT!.......Until the last of June..Then it went into constant reboot mode. It was too late to return it to Amazon so I opened a case with Netgear support, got a case number and an email confirming such. Then nothing but crickets. I have reopened the case and sent multiple emails begging for an RMA, but nothing....I go to mynetgear page and it shows NO phone, chat or email support...WTF? How the heck are you supposed to resolve anything if they won't communicate with you!!! DON"T BUY NETGEAR products unless you want to take a gamble.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Cost / Benefit did not work out
customer_reviews.text: I paid $150 for this to get away from a Comcast $10 monthly modem rental fee. It worked fine for nearly 6 months, then instantaneously stopped working. Comcast came out to check interior and exterior wiring. No issues. They installed a Comcast modem router to ensure this was the problem. Back up and running. So I essentially spent $25 a month for this product. As much as I hate Comcast, I'm back with their modem router. At least they will come out and replace it if it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: E.A.C.

customer_reviews.title: Netgear AC1750 easy to set up, but very unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not completely satisfied with this product. It has both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz connection, but my biggest issue is the wireless wifi, for just a few hours the wifi disconnect and can't be found in the laptop, tablet etc... but the wired internet is still good, it connects fast on the internet only the wifi is the problem. I have to always disconnect to the electricity and connect again for the wifi to work. It's very frustrating. I am returning it and get a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement in performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my Netgear CG3000DV2 cable gateway router as suggested by Comcast Tech Support. I had the Netgear CG3000DV2 for over 2 years although its max speed is supposedly 340 mbps. However, the average download speed is between 40-45 mbps on a 100 mbps Comcast cable. The wifi speed remains the same for the 2.4 Ghz channel but huge improvement on the 5 Ghz. My download speed on the 5 Ghz now matches or better the service i signed up for under Comcast which is 150 mbps and with peak of about 180 mbps. I wished i should have known earlier that Comcast rated speed can only be attained on 5 Ghz channel.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie A.

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: At first this device was working great... and then issue popped up. The wifi kept cutting in and out allllll the time. I tried changing channels to hardset values, but this did nothing. I decided to contact netgear, what a mistake that was. Apparently after 90 days, they no longer offer any type of "service" unless you purchase a service plan of like $150. Total bull crap if you ask me, i bought your unit, you should provide service on it.... So now im stuck with a modem/router that does not work, and i cant get a replacment until the "1year warrenty" runs out and my extended warrenty kicks in... I will NEVER BUY A NETGEAR product again... ever...
customer_reviews.author: Cody St. Louis

customer_reviews.title: You can’t upgrade the firmware!
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find out since it’s a router and modem you cannot upgrade the firmware yourself like you can with routers. If a security exploit comes up you are a sitting duck with this thing. I am surprised it is even legal to sell something like this, it’s totally not worth the slight convenience of being in one box. There is also 9 lights on the front that serve literally no purpose and there is no way to disable them. Also the UI looks like it was made in the MySpace era and has never been redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: PixelRyan

customer_reviews.title: Never getting Netgear again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand new February of this year and it worked great for a few months. Then all of a sudden the router would reset itself every single day. Ive attempted contacting Netgear support and never heard anything. I call and don't get anywhere either. My product is under warranty yet I can't even use it because the customer service seems Like they don't exist. This is such a waste of money and crappy quality also without customer service. Biggest waste of time money and my life on this company.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Welch

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to stop renting one of these. Setup was easy and fast, didn't even have to make the dreaded call to Comcast, did it all online through LTE on my phone while this connected. It'll be paid for in less than a year compared to the $13 a month fee for renting theirs, plus its a better unit. Very happy I did this!
customer_reviews.author: JimWalton

customer_reviews.title: good but will not monitor network usage
customer_reviews.text: I did research on Netgear before I purchased the C6300 router. Reviews praised Netgear firmware/software for traffic monitoring. The c6300 Netgear Genie download can not monitor your internet traffic. I am disappointed that at $178.00 it cannot do what cheaper Netgear models can do. It was easy to set up, its fast. It runs 1 wired connection, 1 smart tv; streaming Amazon or ___flix, 2 tablets, 3 laptops and a Magic Jack. No dropped Wifi or any other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Harping Dude

customer_reviews.title: DId lots of research...
customer_reviews.text: ...selected this one. It's pretty, lots of blinky lights...nice Christmas tree. Seriously, VERY EASY to setup...replaced a 5-yr old SURFBOARD that started behaving badly. I had an 'extender' for 2nd floor, no longer needed. 2.4 and 5ghz run well (for those devices that can attach). SO MUCH MORE capability than what I had, still playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Human

customer_reviews.title: But so far it works beautifully. Very convenient having modem & router in one
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! But so far it works beautifully. Very convenient having modem & router in one. Genie app works with it including “guest WiFi” feature which allows us to control when the kids are online or not, and change passwords from my phone! Updated firmware easily as soon as installed. Good speeds!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Atrocious Customer Service - 1990's Style
customer_reviews.text: My first router started malfunctioning and I spent 2 HOURS - seriously - with Netgear's terrible customer support. Most of my time was on hold. I finally got an RMA and they exchanged the device. This was also a painful experience. The new router was also malfunctioning. I spent another 1.5 hours on hold and going through painfully slow customer service chain to try and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: William Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My old modem/router went on the fritz so went shopping for new one and this was recommended by some collogues and haven't been disappointed. WiFi has been good but for my application I need to have an extender and they paired wonderfully. I like having the USB plug so I can save data and share things from any computer on this network. I have Xfinity and was no issues with setup. You do have to call them and give the MAC number so in their system so will operate properly.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Really complicated to install, had to return
customer_reviews.text: I had previously had good experience with Netgear so I decided to order this. It arrived promptly. The problem was that the installation was complicated and even though i followed the instructions carefully I was not able to setup the internet connection and had to return it. Netgear needs to go back to their older system setup configuration, this new system and UX is too complicated.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast wifi
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to pull the plug on my Xfinity modem rental and purchase my own. This Netgear C6300 modem and router is the best choice for the price range and overall performance. I have been paying for the Xfinity blast 75mbps+Boost up to 150 mpbs for the last two years but have not seen speeds anywhere near that with my previous Xfinity modem. With this Netgear I have been receiving a steady stream of 115mpbs which is much higher than the 55mbps max I had with the Xfinity modem. The setup process was very easy with instructions included in the product packaging.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Okay - when it works. Too bad that now it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this device exactly 6 days past the return window close. Of course I am no longer able to manage it, but thankfully I can still get to the Internet, with some of my devices. Others won't even see the same wireless network I am connected to with others. None were changed, but for some reason they can no longer see the network. Gotta love Netgear and after multiple searches, the final response is to replace it. Great advice when the thing is barely 3 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Codemannh

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: After years of putting up with inferior,slow internet I finally upgraded. This is the box that Cox cable said they used. I bought it from Amazon and had them do the install. Our house was never wired for cable. (We have Directv ). After watching the service tech, I probably could have done it myself. We just had this done in January, but so far, so good. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Haynes Ford

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Straight Forward
customer_reviews.text: Setup on this Modem + Router is pretty easy and it has plenty high bandwidth and signal capacity for my one bedroom apartment (I would recommend it for moderate sized houses also). Plenty of ethernet ports and has both 2.4ghz and 5ghz signal. Highly recommend for console gamers and most typical internet users.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: No Technical support after 1 year warranty period
customer_reviews.text: We purchased Netgear C6300 17 months ago. After a thunderstorm early this month, the modem/router became malfunctioning. I did a factory a factory reset, some functions have been restored, but WIFI is still erratic. Called Netgear, but after explaining the issue, the call was cutoff without any explanations. I understand that the router has passed its warranty period, but hoped to get some technical support / advice from Netgear. This is disappointing. Should have purchase a router with a longer warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Yu Zhu

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, works as promised, I have Spectrum internet as my provider and this is, as advertised, compatible. I now have only the 1 unit instead of a modem and router. Easy install, fired up 1st time, easy process. I definitely recommend this if you want to consolidate both. Also, signal very strong thru house, better than wireless routers I've used. Priced well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIMITED TECHANICAL SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: THE TECHANICAL SUPPORT IS LIMITED TO 90 DAYS. YOU CAN BUY EXTENDED SUPPORT FOR MORE THAN IT WOULD BE WORTH. THERE IS AN APP AVALIBLE CALLED NIGHTHALK YOU NEED TO HAVE AN IPHONE OR SMART PHONE TO GET IT. IT IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH WINDOWS SO THAT YOU COULD USE IT WITH YOUR COMPUTER. I HAVE BEEN BUYING NETGEAR PRODUICTS FOR OVER 15 YEARS. THERE CUSTOMER SERVICE USED TO BE GREAT. IT NO LONGER IS THIS WILL BE THE LAST NETGEAR PRODUCT THATY I BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SCAM!
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY NETGEAR IS A RIP OFF! You pay $175 and in 8 months if you have any issues, which you will, you’re asked to pay for service plans (before the first year!!!! Appliances should last a year) They wanted $250 for three years $175 for two and $80 for a year So they sell s crap product and then you’re despearate and have to spend more money with them, nope! I’ll just go back to COMCAST and spend $130 a year not $175 then money every single year! SCAM!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jmunoz

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: While this model should work with Comcast cable internet, my installer could never get it to work or get a strong signal. He tried for a couple of hours with no success. I returned this item and purchased a newer Netgear model which worked right out of the box without any trouble. Please be aware that often product listed as new is actually refurbished as was most likely the case with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This items is NOT connecting to SPECTRUM for BUSINESS. ...
customer_reviews.text: This items is NOT connecting to SPECTRUM for BUSINESS. We called Spectrum and they said it can ONLY be used for PERSONAL accounts but NOT for BUSINESS accounts. The product page on Amazon does not say that though. Our problem with Spectrum modem is its wifi issues. Now we are buying the following item to address the wifi issue. Hopefully it it will solve our problem.
customer_reviews.author: Areza Medical

customer_reviews.title: This is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched internet providers who install their own prefered brand of modem routers but charge you a monthly rental fee for it. Not wanting to pay them $10+ per month over the course of however long we choose to stay with them, we decided to try using a box of our own that can also accommodate a cable connection in the future & can be used by other cable & internet providers in the event we switch companies. We chose this model & we love it! It has even increased our internet speed slightly from what we signed up for. Great product thus far!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but beware of suggested NetGear Genie download.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and the initial setup was moderately simple. As a non-geek, instructions could have been more complete. Nevertheless, I got it done fairly quickly. One big problem: I downloaded NetGear Genie as the company suggested, and it came bundled with software junk that I had to uninstall, and uninstall...and uninstall. Not good. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars. Buy it .....and don't download NetGear Genie. honest man
customer_reviews.author: honest man

customer_reviews.title: 5G not stable
customer_reviews.text: The 5G signal is not stable. Normally it works very well, but 5G drop off (totally disappeared from Wi-Fi list) randomly. It's not happening every day. I just read from other related device comments that combo routers have this issue. So 3 stars given.
customer_reviews.author: tt2

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cable cord with this Modem Router Combo!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this modem router combo I had a lot of problems streaming TV using the cable company's modem connected to my old router. Experienced constant buffering and would have to restart my router over and over and over. The cable company claimed their modem was working properly but it sure was odd that I never had a problem with my router until I cut the cable cord and started streaming. Since I replaced the cable company's modem and my router with this combo, I have had very little issues with streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Ninette

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT WORK WITH RING VIDEO DOORBELL
customer_reviews.text: Loved for 2 years until I Could NOT get it to work win my Ring Video Doorbell. Myself and the Ring Level 2 Tech changed every setting possible and even set up a Reservation on the Router for the Ring Device. Never would work past a few minutes, if at all. We wasted over 10 hours over 2 weeks trying to make it work. Even got a new Ring Video Doorbell. Still the same problem. Final solution was to get a POS Modem/Router directly from Spectrum. Then the Ring Video Doorbell worked in a few minutes like it was supposed to. Very Frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Ditch ARRIS SURFboard SBG6782, Get NETGEAR AC1750 (16x4) Wi-Fi Cable Modem Router (C6300)
customer_reviews.text: I had originally purchased a ARRIS SURFboard SBG6782-AC DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem and AC1750 Wi-Fi Router and it was the worst experience ever (dropping wifi, wifi connected but not internet, range issues, you name it). After reading other Amazon reviewers who had the same problems as I did with the Arris Surfboard, several people pointed to the NETGEAR AC1750 (16x4) Wi-Fi Cable Modem Router (C6300) which they said resolved all their Wi-Fi problems. And I have to concur, I got the Netgear AC1750 up and running super fast and have had zero issues with it. Highly recommend this wi-fi/cable model combo router. Will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Becerra

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR NOW MAKES JUNK PRODUCTS TO SELL OUTRAGEOUS $$ WARRANTIES
customer_reviews.text: Within 1 weeks time multiple (dozens) of connection drops forced calls to Netgear Tech support. Netgear Tech support is *ABSOLUTELY *WORTHLESS* Netgear Tech Supports Sole Purpose of Existence is to Try And Sell You An Insane $200 Additional Warranty for A 100% Junk Product that Does Not Work. I WILL NEVER **EVER**TOUCH A NETGEAR PRODUCT AGAIN IN **MY LIFETIME**
customer_reviews.author: Wizeguyy

customer_reviews.title: Good router/modem!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I was looking for a router/modem combo because I didn't want to deal with two separate devices and this functions really well. I brought one for my parents and I brought one for myself. Setup is super easy. I've used this with both xfinity and spectrum and it works fine with both.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to a place where Xfinity Comcast was the provider. I had the option of buying my own cable modem router rather than renting one from Comcast. I did the research on the makes and models available and this Netgear was highly rated and was affordable. It runs the latest technology and the split 2.4 and 5 Mhz wireless signals reach every room in our five-bedroom, two-story house. It was easy to set up and I went into the menu to change the settings and upgrade the passwords. I feel confident this Netgear will work well for us over the coming years.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this item!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems with this router. I've been harrassing Cox communications for over a year bitching about their terrible service after 372 days of using this unit it no longer will connect with the internet, now all this time I have to wonder if Netgear was to blame the enite time!
customer_reviews.author: RyanK

customer_reviews.title: NOT SUPPORTED BY COX
customer_reviews.text: COX DOES NOT SUPPORT THIS!! I have had this for about 2 months and everyday I have to reboot multiple times. The wireless drops off randomly with the wires working. I have spent over 15 hours on the phone with Neatgear and Cox going rounds and rounds. Cox does not support 3 party products and right out of the box this needs a firmware update that neither side wants to do. I finally got a second level tech at cox to do it but still hav head to do a factory reset and I am not impressed. I would NOT recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Gamer says no way. Not again. Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: most expensive and most frustrating modem router i've ever bought. I've disconnection issues all the time. I'm a gamer and it's annoying. And when i called customer support? they requested money to help fix the issue. it's incredibly time wasting and frusutrating. I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amro Algamdi

customer_reviews.title: Netgear warranty is WORTHLESS!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! It only lasted 9 months and netgear will not honor the warranty unless you pay $89 for tech support to walk you through trouble shooting which is online. The extended warranty people does not kickin until after a year on the netgear warranty. The item is clearly the problem because 2 min after a reset the internet returns. We were resetting 3 times a day for a week to be sure. We will NEVER buy any netgear product from anyone at any price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer, Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, I think
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's this product or my internet provider but it goes out a lot. Customer service for Netgear is great but they always tell me the modem is fine so it must be the provider. The provider tells me the signal is fine it must be the modem/router. Who knows what the truth is
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews and online recommendations for this product before purchasing. I was happy the first 3 months, then I would lose network and have to reset box. Since it started acting up after return period or free support, I now have to purchase another modem/router. Very disappointed that Netgear would charge customers for support on product that is over 90 days but less than 6 months old. Paid too much for this product and would suggest you never buy Netgear again. Guess I should have stayed with renting from my internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Debra R Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this router for the last two years and have no problems with it. We have a house with a basement and the signal reaches there with no other devises to help. Signal comes through clear and so far no dropping of the signal. We are satisfied with the C6300 Netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: luv2sew56

customer_reviews.title: Wifi worked for 40 days, then died
customer_reviews.text: Currently I'm using the hot spot on my phone to write this review because the wifi stopped working entirely. At first it was just, reboot the modem and then the wifi turns on, but now it's not working at all. It still works for LAN connections and as a cable modem for that purpose, but the wifi is dead. So 2 starts. I think I threw away the box at day 30, I guess I should have held on to it. But maybe they'll send me a new one and I'll have better luck. For the price I would have expected it to work for at least a year or 2.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeBoteaIII

customer_reviews.title: WOW what a difference
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 products replaced with this modem/router combo. Amazed at how much better the reception of WiFi is now. Only one item to place and work with (if necessary). So far we love this item. Very impressed with the product, but not the customer service for Netgear. Rep hung up on me as I was asking a question. Hope I never have to rely on them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bus

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the rental fees
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and get rid of those rental fees. It took me less than 10 minutes from start from finish with no need to call anyone.
customer_reviews.author: DSP

customer_reviews.title: I worked fine for about 6 weeks, then had a problem and returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about 6 weeks and then suddenly I could no longer login to the admin panel. Spent a long time with customer support trying to resolve the issue. Eventually talked them into a refund. I have found that Netgear instructions can be a little confusing sometimes. Decided to switch Brands after I returned this one. I have had Netgear products in the past and have been satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Cant believe I waited this long.
customer_reviews.text: I've had Comcast for years and years whilst paying the monthly fee God damn it. I have 60GB speed and about 10 devices connected so I think this was more than enough for my needs. No need for overkill. Easy set up, in less than 15 min I was back online. Im glad I stopped renting for something I should have owned long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador García

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable modem to replace Xfinity rental
customer_reviews.text: The modem/router I was renting from Xfinity was fast enough but I was having serious issues with it staying connected. Rather than have them come to the house (again) to fix the issue, I decided to purchase this modem/router to see if it will fix the issue. Not only did it resolve the issue (not a single drop in signal since I installed it) but the signal strength is stronger and faster as well. Well worth the money, especially since I'm no longer paying $12/mo to rent one from Xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: good help
customer_reviews.text: I have always used NetGear, and this was my second WiFi Cable Modem Router Combo. I have used the tech support to help set up extra features and others I have done myself. I get good range with the WiFi and no problem with all the things attached at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: dem

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product – Lightening Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! I use Cox for my internet and just had to give them a call to register the new modem. The process took just a few minutes and I was quickly online. Although my previous router was a 5.0GHz DOCSIS 3.0, my connection speed improved by 21.18% after upgrading to the Netgear C6300. The unit was a good size and the web interface was fast (although committing a saved change took a few seconds, which is to be expected). I love having a modem and router combined into a single unit and would recommend this product to anyone looking to maximize their connection speed and range.
customer_reviews.author: W. J.

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!  A wireless modem/router to handle XFINTY's speeds
customer_reviews.text: It took several orders and returns (Thank you AMAZON!) to get a NETGEAR modem/router with the wireless capability to handle XFINITY's top tier speeds and have enough broadcast strength to reach throughout a large 2-story home. 5-Bars in every room downstairs, 4-Bars upstairs...without a signal booster. This C6300 has the hardware to handle 2.4 and 5.0 GHz, switch effortlessly to the. best channels, and a very intuitive and fast set-up. Fast online activation with XFINITY, no problems at all. Very happy with this equipment - Save yourself a lot of frustration and spend a little extra to get get something good.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: and smart TV's. Streaming turned into a nightmare as did ...
customer_reviews.text: My Surfboard modem coud not handle the traffic in my house. Too many phones, tablets, computers, and smart TV's. Streaming turned into a nightmare as did signal loss. The Netgear AC1750 has worked flawlessly. The speed tests show I am now getting the Xfinity speeds I am paying for. All devices are working without any drops or streaming issues. This wasa great upgrade to my home internet.
customer_reviews.author: Cold Hard Truth

customer_reviews.title: Beware - There may be older version of New C6300’s being sold
customer_reviews.text: The C6300 that I purchased from Amazon was really easy to install. A few weeks early I purchased a new C6300 from a seller on eBay. I had to make numerous phone calls to Netgear and Comcast and still could not get it to work. Noted that the Amazon purchased C6300 had a revised installation booklet and I assume an upgraded version of the C6300. The newer version even allowed self-activation without a call to Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Safety Guy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible model. Failed netgear
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I’ve been a netgear fan for decades and this thing tarnished the name. Glitchy, online management gateway takes forever to load. Range doesn’t penetrate >3 drywalls. Connections drop and speed is terrible. I’d smash this thing if it wasn’t 120$+
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: This modem failed after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this modem in January of 2017 and it was dead on arrival, so amazon replaced it with a new one. After 6 shorts months this modem has quit working. It is very dissapointing to have paid so much $$$ for what I thought was a high-end router/modem combo and to have it break down so quickly in its short time of use. Have used netgear for many years, but this unfortunately has broken my confidence in their ability to provide a working product worth spending my money on.
customer_reviews.author: G.R.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This junk stopped working after 10 months , Buy something for $150. I think it will last longer than a year , no good customer service from net gear. Amazon is useless because I didn’t get a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: henry j salas

customer_reviews.title: Netgear C-6300 Cable modem/ WIFI Router
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Easy to setup and easy to activate with Spectrum. No dropout issues and have not had to reset it. The only reason it received an Overall rating of 4 stars is because it was promised next day delivery. I live 2 hours away from the fulfillment center and they changed the date of delivery while I was tracking the package that was supposed to be out for delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up - Good coverage - Reliable Signal
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old router and the cable modem because the WiFi signal kept dropping out and the WiFi coverage was not consistent. The NetGear combined modem / router is much more reliable and a longer range signal. Combined with a NetGear extender resulted in a reliable signal through out the house. I don’t have dropped internet connection anymore. Satisfied with performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and setup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to replace my comcast modem and router and its doing a fantastic job keeping up with the demands as well as the comcast modem so I am pleased with this purchase. 11 devices accessed the router at once and no one slowed down or lost connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: CruzNava

customer_reviews.title: Unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Unusable. Had to reboot several times a day to get wireless devices reconnected. USB readyshare simply doesn't work. I kept losing mapped drive. Network Genie and the web interface are painfully slow. It took the better part of the morning to get this device configured. I'll be returning. I replaced it with a Motorola MG7550. I had the Motorola setup and configured in about 15 minutes and have had no issues so far although I had to sacrifice the usb since this unit has no usb port.
customer_reviews.author: R. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: I bought the AC1750 in May, 2015. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the AC1750 in May, 2015. It's worked well in all that time, with 4 or 5 restarts needed (every few months I need to power it off and back on to reconnect to XFinity,even though the local network is still accessible). The only real issue I have with it is the range. I had a much cheaper NETGEAR WiFi router (not combo) that could reach the farthest room in my house without problem. With this I have to hold my phone towards the door to stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brophy

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a nice and reliable Modem
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice and reliable Modem. This one was looking OK. Works great at the first floor, but somehow the signal to the second one is fading. I changed the wireless channels still the same. If I try to watch Netflix or Amazon on the second floor some times the signal is not enough to get a good quality picture. I can check e-mail but I didnt need a new modem for that.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Used it with Cox and it worked as a charm ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it with Cox and it worked as a charm for a 100Mb service. If you use a router/modem provided by Cox, you have to give them a call to provide details for the new device to make it work. Using 2 bands definitely makes a difference, especially in a densely populated area - effectively gives you 2 wi-fi connections with different passwords. Gives a lot of flexibility with multiple router options and convenient interface. Will pay for itself in about 12 months or so (you will not need to pay for the lease of the provider's modem/router). You do not need to be a guru to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Drol

customer_reviews.title: Beats $13/ month from my internet provider
customer_reviews.text: Apart from getting low signal strength in my bedroom (which has a line of sight access to the router), The WiFi Cable Modem Router has been great. Easy to install and my provider was able to find the model on its activation platform.
customer_reviews.author: Akintoye A.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the NETGEAR AC1750 16x4
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup with Comcast and no issues at all with this Modem/Router. Covers my whole house and then some, very stable connection, no WIFI drops since i have been using it. I would recommend it over a less expensive one I tried a 8x4 Modem/Router and it was not very stable for me. I really think the extra 8 channels help with the stable connection. I have been using it with five devices for almost a month, not one call needed to their tech support or Comcast. I seen one review saying it gets very hot, the one I have is cool to the touch so i don't know what they would be talking about.
customer_reviews.author: William Durkalec

customer_reviews.title: works well and wifi is much faster than my old modem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item used and for the money it's probably the best modem/router you can buy to avoid renting a router from the cable company. The info the cable company needs to hook it up (the mac address) is on a slide out plastic card. It has both 2.4 and 5G wireless so your newer devices will see speeds about as fast as being hard wired. much easier to setup the wireless and change the main password than on other routers I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: lapercussion

customer_reviews.title: They don't work and Net Gear Support People don't listen.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product to anyone. According to my Internet provider support team and Net Gear Support the router was defective. I sent it back and got another. The web address on it did not match what was shown online. Do you think I could get their support people to understand that it showed c8 on the modem/router and ca online. Therefore we couldn't get that router to connect either. I hooked up an ARRIS that was $100 less with no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Prof B

customer_reviews.title: Excelent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product refurbished or open box from Amazon....not sure if they made a mistake or what, but the product looked new. took it out and installed. works very good and signal is strong enough to reach all corners of my house....recomend 100%
customer_reviews.author: CHA

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity Issues
customer_reviews.text: Connection to the router/wifi drops every 12 hours. We received a replacement which worked great for 48 hours and then started to drop connection every 24 hours. However, after a factory rest this time the router became working properly. Although after a week the router became randomly dropping connectivity again.
customer_reviews.author: ZJ

customer_reviews.title: I've had this modem for 8 months and when it works it provides good signal and connection however it drops the wireless signal .
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! I've had this modem for 8 months and when it works it provides good signal and connection however it drops the wireless signal consistently. This is a known issue and I'm forced to restart this thing several times a day to get my wireless signal back, anything connected via a LAN cable still works. Netgear, this is unacceptable!!! Anyone considering this modem just google "C6300 drop wifi" it happens so much I'm sure google will auto populate it.
customer_reviews.author: ECW

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to setup, especially if replacing a prior one
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade due to our whole family using the computer all at once - the old router was getting overworked! I love the fact that it's dual band. You want to put things that stream video on your 5G, and everything else on your 2.4G. Make sure you call your internet service provider, give them the MAC address on the bottom of the unit, and also because it's one unit instead of a separate modem and router, it's one less cord. I recommend it for households with a couple of TVs that stream video along with a few mobile devices.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Redman

customer_reviews.title: works good.
customer_reviews.text: Still working. It plugged into ISP Spectrum/Charter/Oceanic. Anyhow the internet works. Spectrum sucks though because they won't install at my location in Hawaii. HawaiianTel sucks just as much. ALL internet companies suck very bad on Big Island.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was upgrading my modem/router when I purchased this product. Unfortunately, I took a pretty large leap backwards. This device was not compatible with my Arlo Pro II cameras and we experienced intermitent internet outages. After 4 months of use, I'm File 13'ing this device and going to my local brick-and-mortar and buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Under State

customer_reviews.title: Great router. wonderful for family with netgear's Genie Application.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this router, it handles everything, we have xfinity cable at 150 mps and it works wonderfully with it. I really like Netgears genie app also. I can customize parental controls for every device and keep my grandson out of unwanted (in my eyes) internet areas. Its a wonderful router. It also keeps track of all the devices adding into the system as people come and go.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Root

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase overall
customer_reviews.text: pros: quick and easy setup, works as advertised, great speeds, good tools in the firmware for things like choosing the least populated wifi channels for best speeds. cons: has IPv6 support, but doesn't support IPv6 port forwarding, and support had no updates on if it when there would be a firmware release to support it. Comes with a built-in "shareready" USB port, but no way of disabling the feature if you don't need it or want it - you just always get to see it in your network.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Contributor

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: So glad we stopped wasting our money on renting a modem/router from Xfinity each month. This device has worked just as well or even better. We have firesticks on 5 Tv's, 1 echo dot, 1 ring doorbell, 2 wi fi plugs, wi fi garage door opener, a Roomba vacuum all connected.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrice

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted almost 3 months. Tried to contact Netgear Support and was routed to a 3rd party "tech support" company which I learned was a SCAM. My only option was to trash it - I bought a Motorola Modem Router. PS: I've used a lot of Netgear products over the years but never expected such poor quality and zero support - never again!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if you get it used.
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the rented crap from comcast. I was getting 35-40MBs WIFI on the Comcast modem I get 75-160MBs WIFI. The setup was fast and simple. Only one issue came up with my laptop wired to the modem. I know my equipment works as I tested it on the old stuff. Tech support cant figure out why my PS4 wired to it without issues but the laptop wont. Im sure eventually I will figure it out when I have more time to mess with it. Overall it is a great improvement to what I had. I purchased this used so in a year it will pay for itself in the $10 rental fee.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Hermanson

customer_reviews.title: Sleek look, steady signal, not too hot
customer_reviews.text: Nice modem, gets the job done. I can't really see the difference between this one and one an internet company might provide, but then again I only pay for up to 100 Mb/s. My only concern is that I had no idea how old this used modem was when I purchased it. Turns out it was a whole year old and now might die sooner than I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought back in Dec 2019 (8months ago). Started having spotty WiFi in April and now the WiFi has to be reset every day or every other day. Not just the tower but to into the the router admin and reset all over again. Waste of $$$
customer_reviews.author: MT&SAHM

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Cox Cable network!
customer_reviews.text: I used this router to replace my Ubee single channel modem that Cox Cable provided me. I was getting good speeds directly connected before, like 115 Mbps,but my wifi devices only got about 4-10. I hooked up this modem and immediately tested my wifi and speed checked devices at around 85 Mbps. I am super happy it works so well. No more loading on my Apple TV. No more issues getting internet down stairs. Very satisfied and it only took 5 minutes and a phone call to have Cox turn it on and activate it for me.definitely reccomend this product if you have a single Chanel modem currently and want to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Brian E

product_meta.title: Netgear C6300-100NAS AC1750 (16x4) DOCSIS 3.0 WiFi Cable Modem Router Combo (C6300) Certified for Xfinity from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, Cablevision & more,Black
product_meta.description: The NETGEAR AC1750 Wi-Fi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router provides the fastest cable speed available with an AC1750 Wi-Fi router and integrated DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem, with up to 680 Mbps. Cable Labs certified to work with all major cable Internet providers such as Cablevision, Cox, Time Warner Cable, XFINITY and more.
feature_bullets: Compatible with Xfinity from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, CableONE & more
Three-in-one DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem + AC1750 WiFi Router+ 4 Gigabit Wired Switch
DOCSIS 3.0 unleashes 16x faster download speeds than DOCSIS 2.0
Ideal for streaming HD videos, faster downloads, and high-speed online gaming
Works with Cable Internet Providers like XFINITY from Comcast, Cox, Cablevision and more (not compatible with Cable bundled voice services)
Up to 680Mbps modem speed and Dual-Band AC1750 (2.4GHz & 5GHz) WiFi speed. 16x4 channel bonding/ Approved for plans up to 300 Mbps
System requirements : Microsoft Windows 10, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, UNIX, or Linux

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,808 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
